Description: Oval dish of Nile silt pottery with flattened base, coated with red slip and burnished on the interior and exterior. Interior walls are decorated in white chalking pigment with originally 10 irregular cross-hatched panels composed of 3 or 4 vertical lines and crossed with 5 or 6 horizontal lines. Paint has faded in many places.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line (C) ware. Published: A. Scharff, Some Prehistoric Vases in the British Museum and Remarks on Egyptian Prehistory, JEA 14 (1928), p. 262, pl. xxiv.4.
